Button hierarchy

Primary and secondary buttons are used to inform the user of the importance of the actions in relation to one another.

Primary buttons

Primary buttons represent the most important actions on the page or within a set of actions. These actions are necessary for the primary purpose of the page. Examples include launching an application, signing in, or submitting a form (apply, save, reset, previous, next). There can be multiple primary buttons on a page.

Small



Medium | Default



Large

<p>Small</p>
<button class="btn btn-primary btn-sm">Primary Button</button>
<p>Medium | Default</p>
<button class="btn btn-primary">Primary Button</button>
<p>Large</p>
<button class="btn btn-primary btn-lg">Primary Button</button>

Secondary buttons

Secondary buttons represent actions that are not crucial to a user's task. They are peripheral to the purpose of the page. Examples include canceling, adding, deleting or editing items in a list, and browsing.

Default secondary buttons

There are two variants of default secondary buttons: white and gray.

The white secondary button is used on colored backgrounds.

<button class="btn btn-white btn-sm">White Button</button>
<button class="btn btn-white">White Button</button>
<button class="btn btn-white btn-lg">White Button</button>

The gray secondary button is used on white backgrounds. This is the default button.

<button class="btn btn-default btn-sm">Default Button</button>
<button class="btn btn-default">Default Button</button>
<button class="btn btn-default btn-lg">Default Button</button>

Cancel button

The Cancel button is a special secondary button. Because the Cancel function essentially undoes all the actions a user has done on a given page, it has a distinct visual treatment that makes sure that the user doesn't accidentally select it, and yet allows the user to find it easily, when they do want to undo all their actions.

<button class="btn btn-secondary btn-sm">Cancel</button>
<button class="btn btn-secondary">Cancel</button>
<button class="btn btn-secondary btn-lg">Cancel</button>

Special button

Special buttons are primary buttons that require extra visual presence. They are best used on colored backgrounds or in very busy user interfaces.

<button class="btn btn-special btn-sm">Log in</button>
<button class="btn btn-special">Log in</button>
<button class="btn btn-special btn-lg">Log in</button>
